sentences: Parrott took piano lessons when she was four years old, then learned flute.
When she was fifteen, she started playing double bass, and after graduating from high school she studied at the New South Wales Conservatorium of Music in Sydney, Australia.
She moved to New York City in 1994 and continued her education on bass with Rufus Reid.
For several years she played bass guitar and sang backing vocals for an R&B band in Manhattan.
In 2000, she became the bassist for Les Paul in his trio's weekly performances at a club in Manhattan.
Parrott recorded her first album, Awabakal Suite (2001), with her sister, Lisa Parrott.
Her first solo album, Moon River, was released in 2008 and consisted of jazz standards.
She has recorded tribute albums to Burt Bacharach, Nat King Cole, Doris Day, Blossom Dearie, Peggy Lee, and the  Carpenters.
